sen.j: 信濃源氏（しなのげんじ）は、中世に信濃国に土着し本拠とした源氏の氏族を指した呼称。
sen.e: Shinano Genji is a name given to the Minamoto clan who was native to and based in Shinano Province during the medieval period.
Shinano Genji is a name given to the Minamoto clan who were native to and based in Shinano Province during the medieval period.
Shinano Genji is a name given to the Minamoto clan who were native to and based in Shinano Province during the medieval period.

sen.j: 以下の数流がある。
sen.e: It consists of the following family lines.
It consists of the following family lines.
It consists of the following family lines.

sen.j: 清和源氏源満快流。
sen.e: MINAMOTO no Mitsuyoshi line of Seiwa-Genji (Minamoto clan)
MINAMOTO no Mitsuyoshi line of Seiwa-Genji (Minamoto clan)
MINAMOTO no Mitsuyoshi line of Seiwa-Genji (Minamoto clan).

sen.j: 源満仲（多田満仲）の五弟源満快を祖とする信濃国を本拠とした一族。
sen.e: This family line was founded by MINAMOTO no Mitsuyoshi, the fifth younger brother of MINAMOTO no Mitsunaka (TADA no Manju), which was based in Shinano Province.
This family line was founded by MINAMOTO no Mitsuyoshi, the fifth younger brother of MINAMOTO no Mitsunaka (TADA no Manju), which was based in Shinano Province.
This family line was founded by MINAMOTO no Mitsuyoshi, the fifth younger brother of MINAMOTO no Mitsunaka (TADA no Manju), which was based in Shinano Province.

sen.j: 満快の曾孫源為公の後裔が中津乗氏、伊奈氏、村上氏、依田氏、片切氏、堤氏などに分かれた。
sen.e: Descendants of MINAMOTO no Tametomo, a great-grandchild of Mitsuyoshi, branched into 中津乗氏, the Ina clan, the Murakami clan, the Yoda clan, the Katagiri clan, and the Tsutsumi clan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処 「中津乗氏」:読み方不明
sen.e: Descendants of MINAMOTO no Tametomo, a great-grandchild of Mitsuyoshi, branched into 中津乗氏, the Ina clan, the Murakami clan, the Yoda clan, the Katagiri clan, and the Tsutsumi clan.
Descendants of MINAMOTO no Tametomo, a great-grandchild of Mitsuyoshi, branched into 中津乗氏, the Ina clan, the Murakami clan, the Yoda clan, the Katagiri clan, and the Tsutsumi clan.

sen.j: 彼らは南信濃に勢力を持った。
sen.e: They wielded power in Minamishinano.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: They wielded power in Minamishinano.
They wielded power in Minamishinano.

sen.j: 鎌倉時代には、伊奈氏の一族である泉親衡などが知られる。
sen.e: In the Kamakura period, Chikahira IZUMI, a member of the Ina clan, was renowned.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: In the Kamakura period, Chikahira IZUMI, a member of the Ina clan, was renowned.
In the Kamakura period, Chikahira IZUMI, a member of the Ina clan, was renowned.

sen.j: 諏訪大社の大祝を代々務めた諏訪氏をこの流れ（依田氏の一族）とする見方も存在する。
sen.e: Some people believe that the Suwa clan, who took over the position of Ohori (the highest rank of the saints in Shinto) at Suwa-taisha Shrine for generations, was a family of the Yoda clan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Some people believe that the Suwa clan, who took over the position of Ohori (the highest rank of the saints in Shinto) at Suwa-taisha Shrine for generations, was a family of the Yoda clan.
Some people believe that the Suwa clan, who took over the position of Ohori (the highest rank of the saints in Shinto) at Suwa-taisha Shrine for generations, was a family of the Yoda clan.

sen.j: 清和源氏源頼清流。
sen.e: MINAMOTO no Yorikiyo line of Seiwa-Genji (Minamoto clan)
MINAMOTO no Yorikiyo line of Seiwa-Genji (Minamoto clan)
MINAMOTO no Yorikiyo line of Seiwa-Genji (Minamoto clan).

sen.j: 源頼信の次男源頼清を祖とする信濃国を本拠とした一族。
sen.e: This family line was founded by MINAMOTO no Yorikiyo, the second son of MINAMOTO no Yorinobu, which was based in Shinano Province.
This family line was founded by MINAMOTO no Yorikiyo, the second son of MINAMOTO no Yorinobu, which was based in Shinano Province.

sen.j: 信濃村上氏が知られる。
sen.e: The Shinano-Murakami clan (Murakami-clan in Shinano Province) was renowned.
The Shinano-Murakami clan (Murakami-clan in Shinano Province) was renowned.
The Shinano-Murakami clan (Murakami-clan in Shinano Province) was renowned.

sen.j: 清和源氏源頼季流。
sen.e: MINAMOTO no Yorisue line of Seiwa-Genji (Minamoto clan)
MINAMOTO no Yorisue line of Seiwa-Genji (Minamoto clan)
MINAMOTO no Yorisue line of Seiwa-Genji (Minamoto clan).

sen.j: 源頼信の三男源頼季を祖とする信濃国を本拠とした一族。
sen.e: This family line was founded by MINAMOTO no Yorisue, the third son of MINAMOTO no Yorinobu, which was based in Shinano Province.
This family line was founded by MINAMOTO no Yorisue, the third son of MINAMOTO no Yorinobu, and was based in Shinano Province.
This family line was founded by MINAMOTO no Yorisue, the third son of MINAMOTO no Yorinobu, and was based in Shinano Province.

sen.j: 子孫は井上氏族として信濃に勢力を持った。
sen.e: The descendants formed the Inoue clan who wielded power in Shinano Province.
The descendants formed the Inoue clan who wielded power in Shinano Province.

sen.j: 清和源氏源義光流。
sen.e: MINAMOTO no Yoshimitsu line of Seiwa-Genji (Minamoto clan)
MINAMOTO no Yoshimitsu line of Seiwa-Genji (Minamoto clan)
MINAMOTO no Yoshimitsu line of Seiwa-Genji (Minamoto clan).

sen.j: 源義光（新羅三郎義光）を祖とする河内源氏支流の甲斐源氏の一族。
sen.e: This is a family of Kai-Genji (Minamoto clan), a branch family of the Kawachi-Genji (Minamoto clan) founded by MINAMOTO no Yoshimitsu (Shinra-SaburoYoshimitsu).
This is a family of Kai-Genji (Minamoto clan), a branch family of the Kawachi-Genji (Minamoto clan) founded by MINAMOTO no Yoshimitsu (Shinra-SaburoYoshimitsu).

sen.j: 小笠原氏、平賀氏が知られる。
sen.e: The Ogasawara and Hiraga clans were renowned.
The Ogasawara and Hiraga clans were renowned.
The Ogasawara and Hiraga clans were renowned.

sen.j: 清和源氏源義隆流。
sen.e: MINAMOTO no Yoshitaka line of Seiwa-Genji (Minamoto clan)
MINAMOTO no Yoshitaka line of Seiwa-Genji (Minamoto clan)
MINAMOTO no Yoshitaka line of Seiwa-Genji (Minamoto clan).

sen.j: 源義家（八幡太郎義家）の孫源頼隆を祖とする信濃国を本拠とした一族。
sen.e: MINAMOTO no Yoritaka MINAMOTO no Yoshiie (HACHIMANTARO Yoshiie)
MINAMOTO no Yoritaka MINAMOTO no Yoshiie (HACHIMANTARO Yoshiie)
This family line was founded by MINAMOTO no Yoritaka, a grandson of MINAMOTO no Yoshiie (HACHIMANTARO Yoshiie), and was based in Shinano Province.
sen.cmt: 文の一部が訳漏れのため、訳出しました。

sen.j: 若槻氏、多胡氏が知られる。
sen.e: the Wakatsuki clan the Tago clan
The Wakatsuki and Tago clans

sen.j: 清和源氏源為義流。
sen.e: MINAMOTO no Tameyoshi line of Seiwa-Genji (Minamoto clan)
MINAMOTO no Tameyoshi line of Seiwa-Genji (Minamoto clan)
MINAMOTO no Tameyoshi line of Seiwa-Genji (Minamoto clan).

sen.j: 源義仲（木曾次郎義仲）を祖とする河内源氏の一族。
sen.e: This is a family of Kawachi-Genji (Minamoto clan) founded by MINAMOTO no Yoshinaka (Kiso-Jiro Yoshinaka).
This is a family of Kawachi-Genji (Minamoto clan) founded by MINAMOTO no Yoshinaka (Kiso-Jiro Yoshinaka).
This is a family of Kawachi-Genji (Minamoto clan) founded by MINAMOTO no Yoshinaka (Kiso-Jiro Yoshinaka).

sen.j: 河内源氏の源為義の子の源義賢が甥の源義平に討たれた。
sen.e: MINAMOTO no Yoshikata, a son of MINAMOTO no Tameyoshi who was a member of Kawachi-Genji (Minamoto clan), was killed by his own nephew, MINAMOTO no Yoshihira.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: MINAMOTO no Yoshikata, a son of MINAMOTO no Tameyoshi who was a member of Kawachi-Genji (Minamoto clan), was killed by his own nephew, MINAMOTO no Yoshihira.
MINAMOTO no Yoshikata, a son of MINAMOTO no Tameyoshi who was a member of Kawachi-Genji (Minamoto clan), was killed by his own nephew, MINAMOTO no Yoshihira.

sen.j: 義賢の子の源義仲（木曽義仲）は信濃国木曾谷の豪族の中原兼遠の元で育った。
sen.e: MINAMOTO no Yoshinaka (Yoshinaka KISO), a son of Yoshikata, was fostered by NAKAHARA no Kaneto, a gozoku (local ruling family) who was based in Kisodani, Shinano Province.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: MINAMOTO no Yoshinaka (Yoshinaka KISO), a son of Yoshikata, was fostered by NAKAHARA no Kaneto, a local ruling family based in Kisodani, Shinano Province.
MINAMOTO no Yoshinaka (Yoshinaka KISO), a son of Yoshikata, was fostered by NAKAHARA no Kaneto, a local ruling family based in Kisodani, Shinano Province.

sen.j: 源義仲（木曽義仲）が信濃国木曽谷を領した頃から始まる。
sen.e: The family line dates back to the time when MINAMOTO no Yoshinaka (Yoshinaka KISO) wielded control over Kisodani, Shinano Province.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The family line dates back to the time when MINAMOTO no Yoshinaka (Yoshinaka KISO) wielded control over Kisodani, Shinano Province.

sen.j: おもな氏族には、義仲の子孫を称する木曽氏がいる。
sen.e: Renowned clans of this line include the Kiso clan who claimed themselves as descendants of Yoshinaka.
